segment.source: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Web Applications
segment.target: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Web Applications

segment.source: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Web Applications
segment.target: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Web Applications

segment.source: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Web Applications
segment.target: How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Web Applications

segment.source: This topic explains how to configure the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 web applications for the recommended High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5 by using one of the following methods:
segment.target: This topic explains how to configure the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 web applications for the recommended High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5 by using one of the following methods:

segment.source: A Windows PowerShell cmdlet
segment.target: A Windows PowerShell cmdlet

segment.source: The MBAM Server Configuration wizard
segment.target: The MBAM Server Configuration wizard

segment.source: The web applications comprise the following websites and their corresponding web services:
segment.target: The web applications comprise the following websites and their corresponding web services:

segment.source: Website
segment.target: Website

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: Website where specified users can view reports and help end users recover their computers when they forget their PIN or password
segment.target: Website where specified users can view reports and help end users recover their computers when they forget their PIN or password

segment.source: Self-Service Portal
segment.target: Self-Service Portal

segment.source: Website that end users can access to independently regain access to their computers if they forget their PIN or password
segment.target: Website that end users can access to independently regain access to their computers if they forget their PIN or password

segment.source: Before you start the configuration:
segment.target: Before you start the configuration:

segment.source: Step
segment.target: Step

segment.source: Where to get instructions
segment.target: Where to get instructions

segment.source: Review the recommended architecture for MBAM.
segment.target: Review the recommended architecture for MBAM.

segment.source: High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5
segment.target: High-Level Architecture for MBAM 2.5

segment.source: Review the supported configurations for MBAM.
segment.target: Review the supported configurations for MBAM.

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations

segment.source: Complete the required prerequisites on each server.
segment.target: Complete the required prerequisites on each server.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Ensure that you configure SQL ServerReporting Services (SSRS) to use the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) before you configure the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Ensure that you configure SQL ServerReporting Services (SSRS) to use the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) before you configure the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: Otherwise, the Reports feature will use HTTP instead of HTTPS.
segment.target: Otherwise, the Reports feature will use HTTP instead of HTTPS.

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites that Apply Only to the Configuration Manager Integration Topology (if applicable)
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites that Apply Only to the Configuration Manager Integration Topology (if applicable)

segment.source: Register service principal names (SPNs) for the application pool account for the websites.
segment.target: Register service principal names (SPNs) for the application pool account for the websites.

segment.source: You need to do this step only if you do not have administrative domain rights in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).
segment.target: You need to do this step only if you do not have administrative domain rights in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).

segment.source: If you do have these rights in AD DS, MBAM will create the SPNs for you.
segment.target: If you do have these rights in AD DS, MBAM will create the SPNs for you.

segment.source: Planning How to Secure the MBAM Websites
segment.target: Planning How to Secure the MBAM Websites

segment.source: Install the MBAM Server software on each server where you will configure an MBAM Server feature.
segment.target: Install the MBAM Server software on each server where you will configure an MBAM Server feature.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you plan to install the websites on one server and the web services on another, you will be able to configure them only by using the Enable-MbamWebApplication Windows PowerShell cmdlet.
segment.target: If you plan to install the websites on one server and the web services on another, you will be able to configure them only by using the Enable-MbamWebApplication Windows PowerShell cmdlet.

segment.source: The MBAM Server Configuration wizard does not support configuring these items on separate servers.
segment.target: The MBAM Server Configuration wizard does not support configuring these items on separate servers.

segment.source: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software
segment.target: Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software

segment.source: Review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell if you plan to use cmdlets to configure MBAM Server features.
segment.target: Review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell if you plan to use cmdlets to configure MBAM Server features.

segment.source: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: To configure the web applications by using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: To configure the web applications by using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Before you start the configuration, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell to review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: Before you start the configuration, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell to review the prerequisites for using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Use the Enable-MbamWebApplication cmdlet to configure the web applications using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: Use the Enable-MbamWebApplication cmdlet to configure the web applications using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: To get information about this cmdlet, type Get-Help Enable-MbamWebApplication.
segment.target: To get information about this cmdlet, type Get-Help Enable-MbamWebApplication.

segment.source: To configure the settings for all web applications using the wizard
segment.target: To configure the settings for all web applications using the wizard

segment.source: On the server where you want to configure the web applications, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard.
segment.target: On the server where you want to configure the web applications, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard.

segment.source: You can select MBAM Server Configuration from the Start menu to open the wizard.
segment.target: You can select MBAM Server Configuration from the Start menu to open the wizard.

segment.source: Click Add New Features, select Administration and Monitoring Website and Self-Service Portal, and then click Next.
segment.target: Click Add New Features, select Administration and Monitoring Website and Self-Service Portal, and then click Next.

segment.source: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the web applications have been met.
segment.target: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the web applications have been met.

segment.source: If the prerequisite check is successful, click Next to continue.
segment.target: If the prerequisite check is successful, click Next to continue.

segment.source: Otherwise, resolve any missing prerequisites, and then click Check prerequisites again.
segment.target: Otherwise, resolve any missing prerequisites, and then click Check prerequisites again.

segment.source: Use the following descriptions to enter the field values in the wizard.
segment.target: Use the following descriptions to enter the field values in the wizard.

segment.source: Field
segment.target: Field

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Security certificate
segment.target: Security certificate

segment.source: Select a previously created certificate to optionally encrypt the communication between the web services and the server on which you are configuring the websites.
segment.target: Select a previously created certificate to optionally encrypt the communication between the web services and the server on which you are configuring the websites.

segment.source: If you choose Do not use a certificate, your web communication may not be secure.
segment.target: If you choose Do not use a certificate, your web communication may not be secure.

segment.source: Host name
segment.target: Host name

segment.source: Name of the host computer where you are configuring the websites.
segment.target: Name of the host computer where you are configuring the websites.

segment.source: Installation path
segment.target: Installation path

segment.source: Path where you are installing the websites.
segment.target: Path where you are installing the websites.

segment.source: Port
segment.target: Port

segment.source: Port number to use for website and service communication.
segment.target: Port number to use for website and service communication.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You must set a firewall exception to enable communication through the specified port.
segment.target: You must set a firewall exception to enable communication through the specified port.

segment.source: Web service application pool domain account and password
segment.target: Web service application pool domain account and password

segment.source: Domain user account and password for the web service application pool.
segment.target: Domain user account and password for the web service application pool.

segment.source: If you enter a user name in the Read/write access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page, you must enter that same value in this field.
segment.target: If you enter a user name in the Read/write access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page, you must enter that same value in this field.

segment.source: If you enter a group name in the Read/write access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page, the value you enter in this field must be a member of that group.
segment.target: If you enter a group name in the Read/write access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page, the value you enter in this field must be a member of that group.

segment.source: If you do not specify credentials, the credentials that were specified for any previously enabled web application will be used.
segment.target: If you do not specify credentials, the credentials that were specified for any previously enabled web application will be used.

segment.source: All web applications must use the same application pool credentials.
segment.target: All web applications must use the same application pool credentials.

segment.source: If you specify different credentials for different web applications, the most recently specified value will be used.
segment.target: If you specify different credentials for different web applications, the most recently specified value will be used.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: For improved security, set the account that is specified in the credentials to have limited user rights.
segment.target: For improved security, set the account that is specified in the credentials to have limited user rights.

segment.source: Also, set the password of the account to never expire.
segment.target: Also, set the password of the account to never expire.

segment.source: Verify that the built-in IISIUSRS account or the application pool account has been added to the Impersonate a client after authentication and the Log on as a batch job local security settings.
segment.target: Verify that the built-in IISIUSRS account or the application pool account has been added to the Impersonate a client after authentication and the Log on as a batch job local security settings.

segment.source: To check whether it has been added to the local security settings, open the Local Security Policy editor, expand the Local Policies node, click the User Rights Assignment node, and double-click Impersonate a client after authentication and Log on as a batch job policies in the right pane.
segment.target: To check whether it has been added to the local security settings, open the Local Security Policy editor, expand the Local Policies node, click the User Rights Assignment node, and double-click Impersonate a client after authentication and Log on as a batch job policies in the right pane.

segment.source: To configure connection information for the databases by using the wizard
segment.target: To configure connection information for the databases by using the wizard

segment.source: Use the following field descriptions to configure the connection information in the wizard for the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Use the following field descriptions to configure the connection information in the wizard for the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: Field
segment.target: Field

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: SQL Server name
segment.target: SQL Server name

segment.source: Name of the server where the Compliance and Audit Database is configured.
segment.target: Name of the server where the Compliance and Audit Database is configured.

segment.source: SQL Server database instance
segment.target: SQL Server database instance

segment.source: SQL Server instance name where the Compliance and Audit Database is configured.
segment.target: SQL Server instance name where the Compliance and Audit Database is configured.

segment.source: Database name
segment.target: Database name

segment.source: Name of the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Name of the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: Use the following field descriptions to configure the connection information in the wizard for the Recovery Database.
segment.target: Use the following field descriptions to configure the connection information in the wizard for the Recovery Database.

segment.source: Field
segment.target: Field

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: SQL Server name
segment.target: SQL Server name

segment.source: Name of the server where the Recovery Database is configured.
segment.target: Name of the server where the Recovery Database is configured.

segment.source: SQL Server database instance
segment.target: SQL Server database instance

segment.source: SQL Server instance name where the Recovery Database is configured.
segment.target: SQL Server instance name where the Recovery Database is configured.

segment.source: Database name
segment.target: Database name

segment.source: Name of the Recovery Database.
segment.target: Name of the Recovery Database.

segment.source: To configure the web applications by using the wizard
segment.target: To configure the web applications by using the wizard

segment.source: Use the following descriptions to enter the field values in the wizard to configure the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Use the following descriptions to enter the field values in the wizard to configure the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: Field
segment.target: Field

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Advanced Helpdesk role domain group
segment.target: Advanced Helpdesk role domain group

segment.source: Domain user group whose members have access to all areas of the Administration and Monitoring Website except the Reports area.
segment.target: Domain user group whose members have access to all areas of the Administration and Monitoring Website except the Reports area.

segment.source: Helpdesk role domain group
segment.target: Helpdesk role domain group

segment.source: Domain user group whose members have access to the Manage TPM and Drive Recovery areas of the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Domain user group whose members have access to the Manage TPM and Drive Recovery areas of the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: Use System Center Configuration Manager Integration
segment.target: Use System Center Configuration Manager Integration

segment.source: Select this check box if you are configuring MBAM with the Configuration Manager Integration topology.
segment.target: Select this check box if you are configuring MBAM with the Configuration Manager Integration topology.

segment.source: Selecting this check box makes all reports, except the Recovery Audit report, appear in Configuration Manager instead of in the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Selecting this check box makes all reports, except the Recovery Audit report, appear in Configuration Manager instead of in the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: Reporting role domain group
segment.target: Reporting role domain group

segment.source: Domain user group whose members have read-only access to the Reports area of the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Domain user group whose members have read-only access to the Reports area of the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: SQL Server Reporting Services URL
segment.target: SQL Server Reporting Services URL

segment.source: URL for the SSRS server where the MBAM Reports are configured.
segment.target: URL for the SSRS server where the MBAM Reports are configured.

segment.source: Examples of report URLs:
segment.target: Examples of report URLs:

segment.source: Type of host name
segment.target: Type of host name

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: Example with a fully qualified domain name
segment.target: Example with a fully qualified domain name

segment.source: https://MyReportServer.Contoso.com/ReportServer
segment.target: https://MyReportServer.Contoso.com/ReportServer

segment.source: Example with a custom host name
segment.target: Example with a custom host name

segment.source: https://MyReportServer/ReportServer
segment.target: https://MyReportServer/ReportServer

segment.source: Virtual directory
segment.target: Virtual directory

segment.source: Virtual directory of the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Virtual directory of the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: This name corresponds to the website’s physical directory on the server and is appended to the website’s host name, for example:
segment.target: This name corresponds to the website’s physical directory on the server and is appended to the website’s host name, for example:

segment.source: http(s)://hostname:port/HelpDesk/
segment.target: http(s)://hostname:port/HelpDesk/

segment.source: If you do not specify a virtual directory, the value HelpDesk will be used.
segment.target: If you do not specify a virtual directory, the value HelpDesk will be used.

segment.source: Data Migration role domain group (optional)
segment.target: Data Migration role domain group (optional)

segment.source: Domain user group whose members have access to use the Write-Mbam*Information Cmdlets to write recovery information via this endpoint.
segment.target: Domain user group whose members have access to use the Write-Mbam*Information Cmdlets to write recovery information via this endpoint.

segment.source: Use the following description to enter the field values in the wizard to configure the Self-Service Portal.
segment.target: Use the following description to enter the field values in the wizard to configure the Self-Service Portal.

segment.source: Field
segment.target: Field

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Virtual directory
segment.target: Virtual directory

segment.source: Virtual directory of the web application.
segment.target: Virtual directory of the web application.

segment.source: This name corresponds to the website’s physical directory on the server, and is appended to the website’s host name, for example:
segment.target: This name corresponds to the website’s physical directory on the server, and is appended to the website’s host name, for example:

segment.source: http(s)://hostname:port/SelfService/
segment.target: http(s)://hostname:port/SelfService/

segment.source: If you do not specify a virtual directory, the value SelfService will be used.
segment.target: If you do not specify a virtual directory, the value SelfService will be used.

segment.source: Company name
segment.target: Company name

segment.source: Specify a company name for the Self-Service Portal, for example:
segment.target: Specify a company name for the Self-Service Portal, for example:

segment.source: Contoso IT
segment.target: Contoso IT

segment.source: This company name is viewed by all Self-Service Portal users.
segment.target: This company name is viewed by all Self-Service Portal users.

segment.source: Helpdesk URL text
segment.target: Helpdesk URL text

segment.source: Specify a text statement that directs users to your organization's Helpdesk website, for example:
segment.target: Specify a text statement that directs users to your organization's Helpdesk website, for example:

segment.source: Contact Helpdesk or IT department
segment.target: Contact Helpdesk or IT department

segment.source: Helpdesk URL
segment.target: Helpdesk URL

segment.source: Specify the URL for your organization's Helpdesk website, for example:
segment.target: Specify the URL for your organization's Helpdesk website, for example:

segment.source: http(s)://companyHelpdeskURL
segment.target: http(s)://companyHelpdeskURL

segment.source: Notice text file
segment.target: Notice text file

segment.source: Select a file that contains the notice you want displayed to users on the Self-Service Portal landing page.
segment.target: Select a file that contains the notice you want displayed to users on the Self-Service Portal landing page.

segment.source: Do not display notice text to users
segment.target: Do not display notice text to users

segment.source: Select this check box to specify that the notice text is not displayed to users.
segment.target: Select this check box to specify that the notice text is not displayed to users.

segment.source: When you finish your entries, click Next.
segment.target: When you finish your entries, click Next.

segment.source: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the web applications have been met.
segment.target: The wizard checks that all prerequisites for the web applications have been met.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: On the Summary page, review the features that will be added.
segment.target: On the Summary page, review the features that will be added.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To create a Windows PowerShell script for the entries you made, click Export PowerShell Script and save the script.
segment.target: To create a Windows PowerShell script for the entries you made, click Export PowerShell Script and save the script.

segment.source: Click Add to add the web applications to the server, and then click Close.
segment.target: Click Add to add the web applications to the server, and then click Close.

segment.source: To customize the Self-Service Portal by adding custom notice text, your company name, pointers to more information, and so on, see Customizing the Self-Service Portal for Your Organization.
segment.target: To customize the Self-Service Portal by adding custom notice text, your company name, pointers to more information, and so on, see Customizing the Self-Service Portal for Your Organization.

segment.source: To configure the Self-Service Portal if client computers cannot access the CDN
segment.target: To configure the Self-Service Portal if client computers cannot access the CDN

segment.source: Determine whether you are running Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1.
segment.target: Determine whether you are running Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1.

segment.source: If so, do nothing.
segment.target: If so, do nothing.

segment.source: Your Self-Service Portal configuration is complete.
segment.target: Your Self-Service Portal configuration is complete.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1 installs the JavaScript files in setup, and so does not need to be connected to the Microsoft Ajax Content Delivery Network in order to configure the Self-Service Portal.
segment.target: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1 installs the JavaScript files in setup, and so does not need to be connected to the Microsoft Ajax Content Delivery Network in order to configure the Self-Service Portal.

segment.source: The following steps are necessary only if you are using a version of Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 previous to SP1.
segment.target: The following steps are necessary only if you are using a version of Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 previous to SP1.

segment.source: Determine if your client computers have access to the Microsoft Ajax Content Delivery Network (CDN).
segment.target: Determine if your client computers have access to the Microsoft Ajax Content Delivery Network (CDN).

segment.source: The CDN gives the Self-Service Portal the access it requires to certain JavaScript files.
segment.target: The CDN gives the Self-Service Portal the access it requires to certain JavaScript files.

segment.source: If you don’t configure the Self-Service Portal when client computers cannot access the CDN, only the company name and the account under which the end user signed in will be displayed.
segment.target: If you don’t configure the Self-Service Portal when client computers cannot access the CDN, only the company name and the account under which the end user signed in will be displayed.

segment.source: No error message will be shown.
segment.target: No error message will be shown.

segment.source: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Do one of the following:

segment.source: If your client computers have access to the CDN, do nothing.
segment.target: If your client computers have access to the CDN, do nothing.

segment.source: Your Self-Service Portal configuration is complete.
segment.target: Your Self-Service Portal configuration is complete.

segment.source: If your client computers do not have access to the CDN, complete the steps in How to Configure the Self-Service Portal When Client Computers Cannot Access the Microsoft Content Delivery Network.
segment.target: If your client computers do not have access to the CDN, complete the steps in How to Configure the Self-Service Portal When Client Computers Cannot Access the Microsoft Content Delivery Network.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for MBAM?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: Got a MBAM issue?
segment.target: Got a MBAM issue?

segment.target: Use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
